floodArea.riverOrSea: River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.message:
River and lake levels in the area are consistently dropping and are anticipated to keep declining due to the predicted dry weather conditions.
It is expected that this Flood Alert will remain in force until into the weekend. 

Low lying land and roads near the Rivers Brathay, Rothay and Winster and other watercourses, from Grasmere to Grange-over-Sands including areas around Ambleside, Skelwith Bridge, Windermere, Hawkshead, Newby Bridge, Backbarrow, Cark and Cartmel may still be affected.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 31/08/2024, or as the situation changes

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
River and lake levels in the area continue to fall and this trend will continue due to a forecast for drier weather conditions.

It is expected that this Flood Alert will remain in force until into the weekend. 

Low lying land and roads near the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water may still be affected.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 31/08/2024, or as the situation changes.

River and lake levels in the area continue to fall and are expected to continue this trend due to a forecast for drier weather conditions.

It is expected that this Flood Warning will remain in force into the weekend. 

Low lying land bordering the shores of Derwent Water and the frontage of the Keswick Camping and Caravan Club Site may still be affected.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 31/08/2024, or as the situation changes.
